revised_title: Ancient Metal Stamps and the Roman Approach to Printing
tldr: The article discusses an ancient metal stamp found in the collection of Charles Duke of Richmond, which demonstrates the Romans' near-arrival at the art of printing. The stamp features raised letters and was likely used to sign documents or mark paper, showcasing the Roman understanding of printing principles. The author compares the stamp to modern printing techniques and suggests that the Romans only needed to create longer stamps with more lines to print entire pages.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > History of Art and Culture
